definition[0]: to make a sound less loud and clear, especially by covering something
example[0]: The falling snow muffled the sound of our footsteps.
example[1]: Her voice was muffled by the pillow in which she had hidden her face.
definition[1]: to cover yourself or another person with something thick and warm
example[2]: Penelope arrived, muffled up in a thick coat.
explanation[0]: Muffle is usually passive in this meaning
